title: Trump threatens to sue BBC for $1.5bn over 'misleading' edit of speech | ABC NEWS
description: Lawyers for US President Donald Trump have threatened to sue the BBC for AUD$1.5 billion over a “salacious” documentary. A BBC spokesperson says the corporation will review Mr Trump's letter and respond in due course. title: What’s the catch with three hours of free power? | ABC News Daily podcast
description: We want to hear from you! Please complete our survey: 2025 ABC News Daily Audience Survey (https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=mkDBl3hw50e7lNHlNQPgEpOxE0YscZ5Au4rK0pnU0zpURUxPU0ZaM0g0M1NaSEg4QVFVUFFKMVc4Uy4u)    Three hours of free electricity sounds pretty good to many Australians struggling with a cost-of-living crisis.   But is the federal government’s latest solar offering, which features energy retailers being made to offer free power in the middle of the day in selected states, really going to reduce hefty power bills?   Today, energy expert from the Grattan Institute Alison Reeve unpacks the ups and downs of the scheme that’s set to start in July next year.   Featured:    Alison Reeve, energy and climate change deputy program director at the Grattan Institute

title: 50 years on: Gough Whitlam's 1975 dismissal speech | ABC NEWS
description: "Well may we say, "God save the Queen", because nothing will save the Governor-General!" Fifty years ago today, Australian prime minister Gough Whitlam's term abruptly ended when his government was dismissed by governor-general Sir John Kerr. Whitlam was Australia’s 21st prime minister and his Labor government, the first after more than two decades, implemented significant reforms, including national health care and social justice initiatives. However, Whitlam faced a hostile Senate, which led to political tensions and a budgetary crisis in 1975. He is the only Australian prime minister to have been dismissed from office. title: What's the significance of Trump 's White House meeting with Syria's new president? | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump says he wants to make Syria successful, after meeting with the country's new leader Ahmed al-Sharaa at the White House.  He took power in late 2024 after the rebel force he led successfully overthrew long-time president, Bashar al-Assad. Middle East analyst Dr Dara Conduit from Melbourne University says the visit is a huge development for the country and Ahmed al-Shaara, who was once branded a terrorist by the United States. title: Scientists found a giant spider city in a cave | ABC NEWS
description: If the words 'arachnid supercity' set your pulse racing ... maybe sit this one out. In Sulfur Cave, straddling the Greek–Albanian border, lies what could be the largest spider web ever found, a recent study has revealed. After first discovering the colonial spider community in 2022, researchers now estimate the more than 100-square-metre web is home to around 110,000 spiders. Two different species inhabit the web, each genetically distinct from their relatives on the surface.  The researchers also say it's the first time these usually solitary spiders have been seen forming colonies, a finding the team describes as "extraordinary." It's thought the reason for the Sulfur Cave's popularity with spiders is the huge number of midges that also dwell in its depths, offering a plentiful food source for the arachnids.
